text: Thanks Carter, truly appreciated. I will let my dev team know.
Hi

In terms of HubSpot integration, we need to use the Forms API to send data to HubSpot. But based on the new version of HubSpot api the form api is presently in beta.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/forms>

Therefore, to send form submission data to HubSpot, we can use the earlier version of the API endpoints
This is the earlier verison of the api endpoint <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/forms_overview?_ga=2.137423027.2063364400.1678267637-618009211.1678267637>

Can someone to clarify on the below questions?
1. What specifically can we not do with the new release?
2. Would the earlier version be outdated soon?
the requirement is that Map HubSpot data fields v/s Website.

Hi guys,

is it posible to create a group of companies using bach actions?  Because i havent been able to find any documentation for this particular scenario.
The only two pages that i found are "Update a group of companies" and "Create or update a group of contacts" so im basically guessing at this point.
Does somebody know exaclty how does its endpoint look like? I tried using this one "<https://api.hubapi.com/companies/v3/companies/batch>" and i get a Status 400 Bad Request answer with the next body:
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Invalid input JSON on line 9, column 3: Cannot build CreateObjectRequest, some of required attributes are not set [object]",
    "correlationId": "e87153f6-02d9-4414-a91e-e98a47ebcd63"
}

Thanks in advance
no problemm :))
That new api is for things like updating or creating forms, not for submitting form data which is what you're trying to do
The v3 endpoint <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3_authentication> will not be outdated anytime soon
It looks like you have an issue with you're request body, do you mind sharing that?
of course
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/line_items>
Is there a way to fetch deal properties using line item ID?
hi all has anyone have done a greenhouse to HubSpot API integration, not the simple script to iframe but more or less a custom page with custom styled job postings via api?
You could look up the associated deal using the associations api and then read the property but you couldn't do it in one api request it would be 2

If I already have an api secondary domain established in my HubSpot account and my developer wants to attach another IP address to it for website page calls, is that possible or do I need to create a new domain?
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PU4LV8/p1678289273553419>

good afternoon HubSpot team I have a question that I would like you to help me with.

I have a private application and I want to activate webhook but I understand that I must have a developer account. how do I activate the webhook of my private application with this account (it already has information that I want to preserve).
webhooks are not available for private apps at this point.

thanks for the info.

I would appreciate to know when this functionality will be ready. how can I help you to have information about it?
Hi everyone, my coworker made a cleaned-up version of the contact list in HubSpot, is there a way access this via the API using Python?
Right now I am using Contacts = api_client_contacts.crm.contacts.get_all() to get all the contacts, but wanted to see if there is something specific to grab the cleaned up version of her contact list
You could subscribe to the changelog you'll get a ping when something like that is available: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog>
You can use all this api to get the contacts inside of a list: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/lists/get_list_contacts?_ga=2.51593961.1543165680.1678205961-1923218860.1678205961>
But I want to get a very specific verison of contact list that my coworker created
There aren't different versions of contacts lists
Is it a view or a list?
a view
Sorry, I put it as different version in my head
You're good man, so currently you can't get all the contacts for a particular view but you could use the search api to setup the same filters and pull those contacts
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
I don't think this answers my question
Your question: How to get the contacts for a particular view. Answer: You can't, but an alternative way to do this is to setup the same filters from the view in the search api.
Ahh okay, I didn't see your message above the link you sent
Sorry again about that
you're fine
Hi Darren, I haven’t needed to use those webhooks but others I use such as new line item have been fine (generally after a few seconds delay)
For now, just create a developer account app to send the webhook to your private app. You need to use OAuth 2.0 for developer apps but it’s easy to define the webhooks in the Developer UI

Webhooks will be sent from any portal that installs your app. The portal doesn’t need to be Pro or Enterprise. Beware HubSpot will batch up to 100 webhooks in a single message, and there may be duplicates.
<@U04SUPYJ8HZ> see above
